author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Thai
description: Lack of official Thai content . Thus Thai speakers cannot learn in their native language. There are 80 million speakers globally.

f6_assessments.q0: Thailand is one of the countries with the most developed economies in Southeast Asia. With a young and dynamic population, especially the government and people's interest in cryptocurrencies is huge. This is a very potential market for any ecosystem that wants to develop. Cardano in Thai is a great idea to help Cardano reach this market of more than 80 million people. The translation of IOHK documents into Thai will help the crypto community in this country have the opportunity to study more deeply about the Cardano platform, thereby participating in the Cardano community as well as creating a premise for them. can start with Catalyst. This proposal fits perfectly with what the challenge presents.
f6_assessments.q1: The team that implemented this proposal are all active members of the Catalyst community and all have many years of experience in the field of translation such as Dimitri Fernando, Muttiah Duraiswamy, etc. I believe that with their passion and responsibility, the team. will definitely implement this proposal successfully. The preparation of many translators as well as the careful preparation of contingency finance shows that the team is very well prepared for the possible risks of this proposal. I believe that with this thorough preparation, the team will do a very good job on this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: With 3 months of implementation and the roadmap given, it is very clear that the team is well prepared and I believe that the team will successfully complete the set goals. The $7100 budget is also used transparently and reasonably by the team. I greatly appreciate this. In addition, the group's KPIs are very complete, but I have a small suggestion that the team needs to give more specific numbers so that the community can easily measure. For example: How many people watch videos on Youtube channel Lancardano? How many new members will join the Cardano community through this proposal? How many new members will join Catalyst with roles such as CA, vCA, etc. I believe that if specific numbers are given, the community will appreciate it more.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0:
As noted in the Challenge brief, the majority of stake pools are in Europe and North America, which are largely English-speaking areas. Expanding Cardano content by rendering it more accessible to the roughly 60 Million Thai speakers across the globe, particularly Cambodia and Thailand, as the proposal focuses on, should provide fertile ground for expanding not just a more decentralized stake pool operation network, but also wallets, and teams ready to propose from these East Asian areas. 
Naturally the beneficiaries of this project will all be East Asian folks, by virtue of IOHK, Emurgo, and Cardano Foundation translation projects rendering speakers of East Asian languages more empowered to join our ecosystem, including even their Deaf by virtue of including subtitles which will also thus encompass their writing system. 

Having developers and minds like these welcomed into Cardano and Catalyst spaces is sure to increase participation and help projects as a whole, while also likely yielding developers to code projects in the future as well. 

Moreover, with roughly 60 different languages being spoken across Thailand, making our content available in Thai seems like a great gateway to future projects involving myriad other less-common languages or that may further help communities in dire poverty, which is again right in line with the main goals of this Campaign; helping young and developing economies to grow. 

The proposer shared the SDG rating, and nearly all goals are impacted, therefore this again seems like a project that is very well-suited to grow East Asia and grow Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the referenced YouTube channel has yet to launch, a quite reasonable pace of publishing content has been set. The proposal breaks down month-by-month progressions for the project, and shows a team with impressively strong connections to a network of translators ready and available to make this project a reality. 

The budget is not just quite reasonable and cheaper than comparable translation rates elsewhere, but published quantity beyond what is listed not being charged extra means that this budget is certainly cost-effective. 

The logically broken down steps of the proposal show that it is well thought-out and planned, and has an easy-to-enact framework to put into action, further enhancing the likelihood of this project coming to life effectively.
f6_assessments.q2:
Seeing metrics broken down such as numbers of followers, views, shares, downloads, etc. and on a public site like YouTube renders this a project that should prove to be easily auditable along each step of the way past the initial team gathering during month 1. Also seeing what social media marketing the team puts out, all which should be easy to watch and audit. 

The number of wallets or stake pools from this region joining the ecosystem could further be mid-term or longer-term measures of the success of this project. 

With each time point spelled out and broken down, all in all, this seems like a proposal that anyone should be able to watch and follow the progress of.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer idea connecting local people with local Thailand language Thai is splendid idea, For developed system language barrier shouldn't become a problem in future, Cradano ecosystem should be available and should be part of all, helping Thai speakers to learn in there will be great proposal, the challenge within the proposal of reaching 80m people is big task , this proposal of helping Thai speakers is effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Though the proposal has to much challenge, The goals and metrics kept by proposer is stunning, by bringing all Thai speakers to cardano would definitely be benefiting to cardano eco system, this will help bringing 80million people to block chain and crypto currency, which will increase value of ADA, As they will be providing number of views, subscribers, as everything will be provided, By hiring master translators work can be done faster, With given experience and plan presented it is highly likely proposal will be successfully implemented
f6_assessments.q2: The Budget is based on word uses , per word usage which is new idea as everything will be counted, They have provided details of social media Campaign cost and additional cost for transcription, dubbing, editing, publishing, As they have provided full detailed roadmap plan for upcoming months, The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and proposal will be sucessful.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano should not be limited to one language, by translating Cardano into different regional languages would help it gain more popularity and more reach to the users. The proposer has identified the problem effectively and has addressed the solution to it. In order to effectively market or spread the knowledge on Cardano to all the people of the country, translation of the content of Cardona to local language is required and is the most effective way to reach a larger group of people. In this case, the local language would be Thai, which is very huge community and they are very proud of the language. Hence translating the contents of Cardano in Thai would reach a lot more people than expected and also be appreciated for translating into Thai. Most of the people are educated in their local language and might face difficulties in English, by translating the content to Thai it would benefit a lot of people in getting familiar with Cardano and also the advancements of it. The proposer has effectively addressed the challenge and I strongly believe this application will be a success to Cardano as it will be reach more people and more people will be knowledgeable through this with the comfort of learning in their own language. By doing this it would add a lot of value to the cardona system as it will reach worldwide. The goals of the project are aligned with the challenge. It is also a scalable project and could go global benefiting Cardona on a large scale.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a roadmap on how to implement the project as he has mentioned that he will be uploading a new video every 3 days in the Thai language and hence by uploading the Cardona content in the Thai language on a regular interval of time would attract more viewers and gain more subscribers. The proposer has also provided links and their team has the relevant skills and experience to implement the proposal. It would also be helping a lot of people educate about Cardano in a better way. The budget is also clearly mentioned and they have shown the broken down budget and its use cases. This whole together will be indeed bringing a new community to the Cardona, once someone sees the content in Thai they will be more likely to promote the videos on their own to friends and family to watch them and it will be of a better reach. The proposer has a proper plan and will achieve the goal in the projected time and also has pointed out the necessary resources required to complete the project. The experience of proposer and his team seems to be very impressive and the proposal is likely to be implemented successfully. The proposer has foreseen the challenges/risks they might face and also has alternative solutions to solve them.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has requested 7100 USD as funds to implement this project and he has also provided the breakup cost that will be spent on each individual requirement which seems fair. The proposer has also projected the funds for next 3 months and the money requested will be sufficient to audit the progress. The proposal is most likely to succeed as it going to reach over a community of 80 million Thai speaking individuals. It will be very useful in reaching Cardona into the Indian market by translating the content into regional languages and the reach will be more than expected in the future days. The proposer has also foreseen the difficulties they might face while implementation and also has alternative solutions for the same. The proposer has understood the problems of the locals clearly and has proposed the suitable solution which will benefit all.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal has the great potential to improve the knowledge base about the Cardano ecosystem for Thai speakers by providing translated videos. 

Proposer provides statistics on the number of Thai speakers, but in my opinion, the proposer should also provide more analysis on the level of blockchain understanding of Thai speakers. If blockchain understanding is low, then creating blockchain videos should be prioritized first, before creating content about the Cardano ecosystem. Thus attracting more audience.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer provides good information about the number of translated videos published each month, as well as the duration of videos. Clear roadmap with specific time and output. I would like to know more about the specific content of each video, to better assess whether the audience will get adequate fundamental knowledge about Cardano or not. The information about team members is clear and reliable with linkedIn profile attached, the team as a whole has great experience in both Cardano and translating. However, information about the marketing campaign to attract audience is missing.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposer provides a detailed roadmap with specific milestones for better progress tracking. About KPIs and metrics, the number of comments is a good metric but sometimes misunderstanding in case all of the comments are negative. 
Some metrics I would recommend adding: 
- The ratio between positive and negative comments/feedback from audience. 
- The view rate between videos (increasing/decreasing).
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The project raises the issue that there is a lack of official Thai content. So Thai speakers cannot learn in their native language. There are 80 million speakers globally. It is true that this is a problem that will never be solved because there are always new people joining the community, and it will not be possible to reach all of them. The solution that the project offers is only accessible to a certain number of people, but this is also a useful solution that can partially solve the problem raised.
f6_assessments.q1: The project founder has a lot of experience in translation, and these experiences will be very useful for the project. This is a huge foundation to increase the likelihood of project success. In addition, the project provides a very complete blueprint. Given the set timeframes, I believe the project can be successfully implemented and on schedule. I really appreciate how the project prepares so complete and detailed information
f6_assessments.q2: The ways in which projects measure progress are also varied. With metrics that are always public like the number of videos, the number of video views, I believe that the project participants can trust the transparency of the project as well as the project implementation process by the project team. . In addition, the project also sets KPIs to track progress and increase transparency for the project, I appreciate the flexibility of these KPIs. Looking at those KPIs, the participants will have a basis to believe in the team that they are implementing the project effectively.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: Since people always love to learn all the new things in their native language, which will help them to have clear idea on the subject, this proposal will be effectively addresses such challenge. Since there are 80 mn native people speaking Thai, they are huge group of people to capture the market, where all these people will learn about the projects of block chain in more effective manner and definitely show interest in investing future cardano projects. hence This proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: As translation model in YouTube videos definitely won’t be much difficulty, which has very less chances of getting failure with people like Muttiah Duraiswamy who has Over 30 years’ experience in Ministry of Languages as Official Languages translator, it will be an easy goal to achieve. With the details of all veterans provided, presented data is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has clearly mentioned about survey of Thai speaking people and has provided the details of people who are working on this. This proposal has clear budget breaking, roadmap details and definitely provided excellent SDG goals for its success. It also has explained with what time duration videos will be provided for the audience with clearer idea hence the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer rightly addresses the need for translation of IOHK videos into a regional language. The videos in Native language can better convey the message and hence popularize Cardano, thus help in on-boarding new members.The impact of the proposal would be considerable in reaching more than 50 million Thai speakers in Thailand and around the world.
f6_assessments.q1: Rishantha Welikadage: MBA in business management from Australia===== Muthiah Duraisamy:LinkedIn profile mentions of "Freelance Trilingual Translator at Home".=====Dimitri Fernando-LinkedIn profile mentions "CEO at Enigma Private Limited" since 1996.===== Chamarie Ranasinghe-LinkedIn details not provided. The experience of the people involved should be enough to achieve all the goals of the proposal in terms of business management. The stated 30 years of experience of Muthiah Duraisamy in the field of translation should be enough to execute the tasks involved with respect to high quaity translations. Contingency fees could have been much lower for a 3month project also considering value of $2000 in terms of Srilankan/Indian Rupee.
f6_assessments.q2: The deliverables are 360 minutes of translated videos in 3 months(15k words*3months or 120minures/month*3). A specific target number should have been mentioned for the metrics of followers/views/watching-hours/engagements considering $1500 being allocated for Social Media Campaign.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0:
Note to reviewers: When checking for similarity of wording, between all of these 19 "Cardano in [language]" proposals,  please consider.  Since this proposal is an almost exact copy paste of 18 other similar proposals by the same proposer, this assessment will be similar to the assessments I offered for the other translation proposals by this proposer. 

I have read and considered each of these proposals. The topic of this copy paste proposal by itself, could be beneficial to the Cardano community, if executed as promised. "Provide translated videos in Thai about Cardano ecosystem. Translate the entire content of IOHK. Also transcribed, subtitles offered.' 

Translating very technical materials from the original English into other languages accurately and meaningful would be useful in making Cardano more accessible to non-english speaking potential and existing community members. 

But the number and topics of the IOHK videos is too general to understand the scope, and how useful those videos would be. IOHK presents product updates mainly. They do not provide many, if any "explainer or educational" videos. Does this scope include Charles Hoskinson whiteboard videos? The proposals does not say, Thus he scope and methodology described is not clear enough to allow me to make a positive rating.
f6_assessments.q1:
Note to reviewers: When checking for similarity of wording, between all of these 19 "Cardano in [language]" proposals,  please consider.  Since this proposal is an almost exact copy paste of 18 other similar proposals by the same proposer, this assessment will be similar to the assessments I offered for the other translation proposals by this proposer. 

This proposal relies on the same human resources as do 18 other translation proposals, all to be completed within the same period of time. Though the proposal makes claims of significant resources and experience, no verifiable information or references are provided. 

For example. The proposer describes this experience.

1992-1995 Produced programmes at Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corp. Simultaneous translation
+ 1995 to 2022 - 27 years of translations over 100 languages with native speakers.
and...
Serial Entrepreneur, INFJ, Marketer by profession, Creative by passion, Strategist, Writer, Poet, Storyteller Has background in multiple sectors and has run several companies with groundbreaking technologies in Sri Lanka

+ 1992-1995 Voiced and Produced multiple programmes at Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation in numerous Services including Simultaneous translation on a Trilingual Stereo broadcast every day called City FM.

+ 1995 to present - Over 27 years running a translation agency handling translations in over 100 languages with native speaking Master Translators all over the world.

However, the linkedin profile that the proposer provides for reference says NOTHING about these lifetime experiences.
DImitri Fernando
https://www.linkedin.com/in/dimitrifernando777/?originalSubdomain=lk

Have a look!
In another proposal requesting funding to provide food delivery services to the needy, the proposer offers a markedly different bio.

"I have been involved in social service projects for over 36 years, On planning committees and packing teams for  distributing dry rations during recent lockdowns. I also obtained a special pass to distribute of food rations from restaurants right through the curfew and lockdown"

'Serial Entrepreneur, INFJ, Marketer by profession, Creative by passion, Strategist, Writer, Poet, Storyteller Has background in multiple sectors and has run several companies with groundbreaking technologies in Sri Lanka. Having his first job as a department store Santa at age 12, he learnt how bringing joy to kids and the less fortunate would bring unspeakable joy to life. He worked at Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation on various radio channels under the English Service, and learnt the art of communication, presentation, audio and radio production, and program compilation. Working often in highly tense security situations due to the ever present threat of terror attack on the SLBC by the LTTE he learnt to be cool under immense pressure and not let any crisis affect him. He is a Chartered Management Accountant, and Chartered Marketer. He has also completed MBTI and FIRO-B certifications and is currently becoming an ICF accredited Coach and DISC certified trainer and consultant. He has experience in multiple sectors, including Business Development on a national scale for global brands. He has been involved in social service projects for 35 years. He has been distributing food to the hungry several times a week since July 2018. Even during lockdown he was able to get a special pass as he was engaging in essential food distribution services".

Remarkably different careers!
Virtually impossible.

Two types of deliverables are described. Voice overs and transcriptions. 

"We will translate full videos with its original duration. We will also provide a transcription of the video in the local language.'

But it is not clear if the transcriptions are of the translated voice, or of the original english language audio.

There is no mention of the cost or selection process for the voice over talent in Myanmar language.

Then there is the question of the Master Translator responsible for translations in Fund 8 proposals in 19 languages, during the same 6 month period. A look at his linked in profile gives no information to confirm the bio presented in each of the 19 translation proposals

Muttiah Duraiswamy https://lk.linkedin.com/in/muthiah-duraisamy-22498ab8

Muthiah Duraiswamy has over 30 years of experience handling translations in the Ministry of Languages. He is an Official Languages translator having obtained his certification.
f6_assessments.q2:
Note to reviewers. This is one of 19 proposals that are essentially copy paste of each other, simply changing the name of the language. This this assessment will have high similarity to other assessments of these 19 proposals. It is not possible to vary the assessment rationales just to avoid similarity. 

Given all of the uncertainties about the scope of work promised  (which IOHK videos) in this proposal, the lack of methdology, the questions about team experience and capabilities, the number of videos to be produced in 3 months, and the competing demands on the time of this proposer and master translator to complete 18 other similar projects in the same time frame, it is not possible for me to form a supportable opinion (agreeing or disagreeing) that either the progress or success of this (or any of the other 18 video translation proposals introduced by this proposer) would be auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: Please note this assessment should be taken in context of a set of 19 similar proposals by the same proposer in two challenges, Grow India, Grow Cardano and Grow The only real difference between the proposals being the spoken language used (Thai, Burmese, etc.). In all other respects they are essential the same. Hence it is almost impossible to write 19 distinct assessments, I have tried to find specific differentiators but have also looked at the package of proposals as a whole as, I believe, this will add greater value to the voter. Looking at this specific proposal for translating videos into Thai, it largely meets the challenge brief in seeking to broaden the horizons of the Cardano ecosystem. The proposer should be praised for taking the initiative. I would suggest the proposer uses the comments section to explain voters their rationale behind this multi-proposal approach. That should help with transparency and help people make an informed decision. For example: Are they looking for voters to decide on which languages they prefer thus restricting the choice to the existing community. This kind of defeats the purpose of reaching out to new communities. If this is the case I have done a rudimentary research on number of people speaking each language to help the voters make an informed decision. Given more time, an in depth analysis of demographics would be useful showing current literacy levels, access to technology, levels of education, English speakers, etc in East Asia. Thai ranks top so should be top priority? 1. Thai:50M 2. Burmese:36M 3. Laotian:30M 4. Khmer(Cambodian):15M Where the voter needs to pay particular attention is the entirety of the ask. The proposal therefore under assessment are: Grow East Asia, Grow Cardano – 4 proposals https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/404470 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/403932 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398994 https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/398993
f6_assessments.q1:
The contents of feasibility are duplicated across all 19 proposals.
In simple terms we are looking at a total ask of $135,900 of which $38,000 (28%) is contingency. At a proposal level that is $7100 budget with $2000 contingency. 
My project planning head immediately points to the 28% contingency. It is not clear what this is set aside for. A risk of ADA price fluctuation is noted in the proposals, however one of the proposed mitigations for that is a 10% contingency, the other being to sell funds privately to ADA holders.
In addition the proposals states “We have ample resources to complete the project on time and within budget’, once again raising the question on the need for such a large contingency in proportion to the budget?

  
Now looking at what is to be delivered.
Each proposal states the YouTube channel will be launched with 6 videos. We have to assume that means 6 videos translated in all 19 languages should they all be funded. 
After 3 months 10-20 videos (each translated in 19 languages)
That gives us 380 translations in total at an average of 4 per day. I have run this by someone with experience in this area and their reaction was ‘its going to need a considerable team’. 

So, let’s look at the evidence of a team with the skills to deliver this proposal.
The proposer claims to have many years experience in this field but this is impossible to verify based on the evidence (LinkedIn profile) provided.
The other key resource (Muthiah) presents as a trilingual translator. Specific languages are not mentioned so very difficult to validate of if they have the skills for this specific proposal
Two other individuals are listed, their LinkedIn in profile are well populated but don’t display the skills required to deliver this project.
That leave us with the “extensive network of Master translators”. Again no evidence of their existence of previous work exists so impossible to evaluate.


I believe the proposer has a lot to offer the ecosystem and can suggest the following:
•	Help the voter understand the need for 19 similar proposals
•	Provide evidence that they have access to the skills required
•	Look at a small scope with a set of languages he or Muthiah are comfortable with. Use this as a POC on both the translation and engagement side. SHOW the community this proposal is growing adoption.
•	Take the learnings (e.g. which types of video are interesting your audience) and if a larger (multi language) proposal is what is required submit it in a future fund leveraging in the economies of scale that will naturally provide on the maintenance of socials, contingency & marketing.
f6_assessments.q2:
The metrics are sensible in terms of measuring engagement on youtube which is a great basic piece to measure.
However to really get to the crux of the challenge we need to see the conversion rates into Cardano and/or Catalyst
•	increased interaction between Catalyst and Indian focused projects
•	Number of Indian focused Catalyst submissions
•	Number of Indian focused dapps/services actually built
f6_assessments.reply:
This has to be filtered out.  So many reasons..
Combining into one proposal may make sense to this proposer who may not be from Asia and recognize the huge diversity from state to state or region to region. All languages cannot be done by same people or same social media campaign.  This is why we broke up. Smaller proposals enable people to clearly see we are not here to grab money.   Each language needs its unique Social media campaign to reach people.  We cannot lump everything into one.   

Secondly Why consider the total ask?  The rules state that each proposal has to be considered on its own merit.  Therefore even if  i had a hundred language proposals, if i had a hundred teams of two Master Translators and Two Proofreaders, then it will get the job done. We are doing this for 25 years buddy.   We know exactly how to run a translation project.



He goes on
The proposer claims to have many years experience in this field but this is impossible to verify based on the evidence (LinkedIn profile) provided. The other key resource (Muthiah) presents as a trilingual translator.
I have stated as below, we have and use our extensive network of Master Translator Partners.

The assessor has not read the proposal. It states clearly as follows
The number of people required to complete this task has been calculated.  
We will be using our inhouse resources as well as obtain our Master Translator Partner network to handle overflow of work to ensure that our deliverables remain on track. They would be brought on board as and when needed and budget would include their costs

I can see clearly that this assessor is merely following the wrong ideas of some CAs to say that the feasibility is not good because they believe I alone  is doing Or Mr Muthiah D is doing,  the translations or this internal team is doing the translation of all the 10 languages.  This is completely WRONG.  As mentioned above we are using our External partners who are Master Translators with many years of experience and qualifications in translating as Native speakers of Tamil both in Sri Lanka and India. So his feasibility assessment is wrong. 

How the budget was calculated has been clearly laid out as follows.. if he claims he has read the other proposals he will know that we are doing 15000 words per project. Each word costs 0.08 for complete translation to voicing. This cost comes to 1200 and into 3 months it is 3600.  Then this language needs its own Social media campaign since the users of one language would not care about social media campaigns in another language. So all languages cannot be lumped together to do one campaign.  The cost of that being 1500..  Then for contingency we have allocated 2000.    
Some specific statements that are absolute nonsense=
However, because the primary responsibility of this position is to translate text from English to Tamil, the proposer should include more specific information on their translators' expertise in their Master Translator Partner Network.   As stated we have been doing projects for over 25 years. The definition of Master translator if this assessor doesn't understand is a MASTER OF HIS CRAFT.  A SENIOR IN THE INDUSTRY.   Each one will have different qualifications.  As for our specific master translator, he is the ONLY ONE IN SRI LANKA to write for the Mahawamsa which is like the BIBLE OF HISTORY of SRI LANKA for over 4000 years. It has been written from the time of kings.  This is a role that he alone in Sri Lanka has. So this assessor is talking nonsense
Please filter him out.

f6_assessments.q0: ("The author writes the proposal in different countries, but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project, there will be similar sentences"). This proposal is intended to help Thai people understand Cardano, but the difficulty here is that Thai people cannot learn their language, so the author has provided translated videos in Thai to help people here. understand Cardano and the ecosystem it runs on. The purpose of this proposal is to overcome the ignorance of the people here to create a reliable platform for 80 million Thai people to deeply understand the ecosystem as well as Blockchain technology and cryptocurrencies. The idea is great. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge... The author has proposed a well-defined, goal-directed problem-solving approach that offers a lasting solution, a defined path. clearly defined problem solving. . . The author has scaled up with future challenges and the Thai community of the Cardano ecosystem, the blockchain basics help everyone here build better apps. build a community of players in Thailand. They also outline possible risks, there are also some risk solutions highlighting the challenge by looking at it from a legal perspective. This shows that the author is very cautious with the progress of their project.
f6_assessments.q1: ("The author writes the proposal in different countries, but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project there will be similar sentences"). It is proposed to specify a clear period for activities to be divided into 3 months. The author has a team fluent in all languages ​​with more than 20 years in the industry. I believe the project's roadmap will be on schedule as the author promised. The budget is 7.100 USD, detailed and listed by the author for each category. With the amount listed for each month, I find the budget sufficient to check the progress of the proposal. Suggest an easy way to measure success through the metrics the author has listed. . . It is surprising with the number of years of experience that the group has given, the 4-member group has more than 20 years of experience. I do not doubt the experience of the propagandists, they are all elite members, members that we can follow through social networking sites. With a solid team of experts with good leadership, based on the information provided I think this project will be successful.
f6_assessments.q2: ("The author writes the proposal in different countries, but the content will mostly be the same, so when I analyze the project there will be similar sentences"). The measurement indicators are detailed by the author in 3 months of implementation, each month will produce 120 minutes of video. Well-defined KPIs determine the success of the proposal through the number of views, several followers, shares... The author gives great ideas it tackles effectively the challenge, if it is funded I believe the project will be very successful it will have a good impact on making more people aware of Cardano. However, the success of this project is tied to the success of other projects so I think the risk will be multiplied. . . This project is completely new and is waiting for funding.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0: The team presents the problem and that is the lack of official content in Thai and believes that the solution to this problem is to translate the entire IOHG content. The team claims that they will provide translated videos in Thai about the Cardano ecosystem so people will get information about Cardano and this will ultimately add value to the Cardano ecosystem. The team developed the proposal in such a way that the KPIs proposal correspond to the KPIs of this challenge. This proposal is able to scale to address future challenges
f6_assessments.q1: The team was transparently presented through Facebook and LinkedIn links where we can see all the necessary skills needed for this project to be completed. The budget has been worked out and reasonably presented with regard to the overall budget of this challenge. It would be good if working hours were shown and a detailed work plan was developed to give the community a clearer insight into what exactly will be done within the given time frame of 3 months. It is good that the team covers possible risks and challenges.
f6_assessments.q2: The team claims to translate 10-20 videos within the given timeframe of 3 months. Through the roadmap and milestones, it was shown how the team will complete the video contents, advertise on the social network and continue to translate the videos. KPIs have been presented and developed and the community can easily follow developments in the success of this project.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about the provision of translated videos in Thai which will talk about Cardano ecosystem in Thai language to solve the problem of Thai speakers who cannot learn Cardano blockchain in their local language. 
The proposer seeks to provide translated videos in Thai communities in Thailand as well as international about Cardano and its ecosystem, news and current affairs regarding Cardano project. The proposal explained that the project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by bringing in a new community and that the Thai speaking community will both enrich the Cardano community with its long history and culture as well as add to the developer skills that the community needs. I think this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge  brief because its very important to bring people 
 of Thailand into the Cardano Community . South East Asians are hard working and have been known to be  natural coders and developers. KPIs and goals have been stated clearly some of which are the number of subscribers to the LanCardano YouTube Channel, to mention a few. 
The main risk mentioned is the fear of another Covid variant which may cause a lockdown and halt the physical meetups. The information provided has addressed the challenge and hence my 4 star rating.
f6_assessments.q1:
The plan organized by this proposal includes the use of the LanCardano YouTube Channel which will be launched with 6 videos and build a following while daily adding new content. At the end of 3 months, it will have approximately 10-20 videos. Their aim is to come out with one translated video every 3 days. They will translate full videos with its original duration, and provide a transcription of the video in the local language. 
The budget is showing a breakdown into cost of different activities such as social media campaign cost, transcription, dubbing, editing, publishing and contingency fee with a total budget requested being USD7100 which is reasonable. 
The team has 3 people with varied skills as General ADA Holder, Community Advisor, active members of Town Hall, to mention a few. 
With the information provided this proposal can be successfully implemented. I gave a rating of 4 because it is a well coordinated well written proposal and will have a great impact on the Thai community now and in the future.
It is a new proposal and has provided the SDG rating of 3, 4, 5, 8. etc.
f6_assessments.q2:
The road map is clear showing 3 months stated for the project, with the schedule of activities to be carried out such as published video materials can be checked through the YouTube Channel. During the month two, once the channel is launched  it will be promoted to the target market both locally and overseas. Social media will kick-off. Measuring the progress of work, we will look at the number of followers to the LanCardano YouTube Channel, the number of average views per video, the number of watching hours per video, the number of comments, to mention a few, whilst in measuring the success we will consider the number of watching hours per video, the number of shares, the number of downloads to mention a few. The details provided are sufficient for a successful auditing of the proposal.
This is a new proposal and SDG  chosen are 3, 4, 5, 8.
 I recommend that the team can collaborate with  a few other experienced event and blockchain experts for a greater impact in the future.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has submitted what seems to be a lot (dozens?) of proposals in the Grow India and Grow East Asia challenge categories using the same template and only changed a few details. Apart from the name of the language, i.e. Thai, the number of native speakers has been adjusted but otherwise the proposals are more or less identical and no specific attention to the specific circumstances, Cardano adoption or culture is given. Whether the speakers of the language have a strong preference for local content, prefer videos or podcasts and so on has not been analyzed, and a very similar cost is assumed for each language in the 7k USD ballpark. Every proposal aims to translate the entire IOHK official content, by which I assume are meant product documentation and Blog, in addition to “transcriptions of each video in the Cardano Forum. “. 
In my opinion this fails to address the challenge setting to improve Cardano adoption in East Asia with the purpose of either increasing Catalyst proposers from the region, proposals for the region, SPOs in Thailand, or making the lives of people in Thailand better due to adoption of Cardano solutions. A one-size fit all solution is provided, presumably for profitability given the over 100k USD revenue that realizing all proposed translation services at once would provide for the proposers, and does not dedicate any research to watch kind of content the people in Thailand would actually respond to or how successful Cardano and Catalyst already are in the country.
f6_assessments.q1:
The impression of lack of detail and using templates for various similar translation proposals is supported by some errors in the submission of the proposal. By mentioning LanCardano in the proposal for Thai translation, and falsely stating that Binance is the only way for Thais to interact with crypto markets, does the proposal demonstrate lack of local knowledge or ignorance of the target audience. Additionally, not mentioning that Thailand is one of the biggest user of Facebook and a vibrant Thai Cardano community exists having already published thousands of videos in Thai about Cardano further undermines the credibility and makes me doubt that this proposal could implemented successfully. There is a very high risk that rote translation akin to Google Translate would be carried out, without regard for the delivery of engaging, relevant content. Given the lack of demonstrated cultural and language connection to the target market, I seriously doubt that the project would be a success. 
There is a discussion of risks, the timeline is not discussed in the light of the number of similar project proposed by the same team and how funding for several would impact the implementation. Almost half of the requested funds are not for the translation but “contingency” and “social media campaign” without elaborating any further.
f6_assessments.q2: A lot of possible performance metrics are presented but no quantity targets attached and the roadmap requires simply to “keep translating” without regard for reception, feedback, or being related to KPI. It will be very difficult to audit this proposal as it does not describe what success would look like and what kind of reach it aims for. Simply translating a lot of “official IOHK content” is not going to provide any value for auditors or potential users.
f6_assessments.reply:
The assessor has not read the proposal. It states clearly. 
The number of people required to complete this task has been calculated.  
We will be using our inhouse resources as well as obtain our Master Translator Partner network to handle overflow of work to ensure that our deliverables remain on track. They would be brought on board as and when needed and budget would include their costs

I can see clearly that this assessor is merely following the wrong ideas of some CAs to say that the feasibility is not good because they believe I alone  is doing the translations or this internal team is doing the translation of all the 10 languages.

There is no meaning to this sentence as well as many others he has written. "The only thing that perplexes me is the level of the budget per word: $0.08, the team must provide the market standard of that amount, as well as a contingency cost of $2000 to be covered, and it must be expressly specified.  "  What is this market standard we must provide?  That doesnt make sense as well as his entire premise doesnt make sense.  We dont cover a contingency cost, the contingency cost is there to cover in case of unexpected emergencies and problems.  

Again he shows his bias and attitude of nonsense when he talks the following
One thing to note is the amount of work you have to do in the first 1 month with 120 min videos and then the translation commitments for other Asian and Indian languages, besides Khmer, there are more than 15 languages ​​

He has not read the proposal and is biased. I have said this over and over.  We have times. Do you not understand that? Are you hard of hearing?  

VCAs please filter this out. This assessor is clearly biased.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would support language translation of ADA content to Thai language which fits the challenge to grow Cardano in east Asia. Thailand is located in south east Asia and has a lot of people with rich culture. I appreciate the detailed proposal and feel like it effectively addresses the challenge to grow Cardano. The team promises to translate video with either sub captioning and also DUB! I really think that is an effective way to spread awareness about Cardano in Thailand.
f6_assessments.q1: The team claims to have master translators with up to 27 years of experience translating into the Thai language and others. Another one of the team member also has 30 years experience and both have worked with multiple languages. The fact that the team is so experienced gives this proposal a strong chance at success. The proposal clearly identifies the projects timeline and intentions and gives a good indication the planning will be successful as well. The budget allocated funding and the project promises to translate up to 15,000 words of text and literature per month. This would be a huge success if can be accomplished.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics include analyzing the amount of views and engagement primarily on YouTube. The KPI's are clearly listed and appropriate for this proposal. The Goal would to have translated content on a daily basis uploaded to the site. Since YouTube is a public platform anyone could verify engagement and amount of content uploaded independently.  The proposal has clearly staed its goals and gives a way to track the performance of the project. Can check number of downloads to get exact figures.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!

f6_assessments.q0:
The main task in  the solution to the problem is to translate the IOHK and other YouTube channel videos into Thai language. The main members of the proposal team having the skill and  experience of translation make the task possible. I also consider the availability of  a network of resources at their disposal would contribute to their success.   Upon launching, there is a need to market and promote it to the audience. The proposers did not specify how this is to be done, but in their team they have members who have skill and experience in broadcasting; who have social networking avenues; and, who have experience in project management and skill in people relationship management. I consider these qualities are the plus points for the successful implementation of this proposal. 

They targeted a 3-month work of  producing translated and transcripted videos with a total 120 minutes content for each month or 10 to 20 videos at the close of 3 months. Based on the numbers of videos I have checked available in YouTube channels (732 videos IOHK, Emurgo 138,  Cardano Foundation 119 videos) I consider 10 to 20 videos aimed to be translated and transcripted is reasonable and is an achievable goal. Whether or not  the translation after the 3rd month shall continue is not specified, but I hope they will continue the good cause. 

The budget requested seems to target the manpower requirement. The hardware / equipment budget is not clearly stated, but I would consider they have included it in their costing. Nevertheless they have a plan to apply for more funding in fund 9 if so required.

f6_assessments.q2:
Although the proposal gives the key metrics it does not specify the target numbers that are considered success. Also missing out is the time frame to achieve such target numbers. 

For this reason I can neither agree or disagree.
f6_assessments.reply: Thanks for your fair review. if we make it you too are part of what made us succeed. So thank you once again!
